Topic.Title: Anyone seeing the numbers yet?

Topic.Title: Yahoo beats by 14 cents

Message.Msg: GAAP net earnings for the first quarter of 2013 was $390 million, a 36 percent increase from the same period of 2012. Non-GAAP net earnings for the first quarter of 2013 was $420 million, a 26 percent increase from the same period of 2012. Non-GAAP net earnings for the quarter would have been $386 million including stock-based compensation expense of $34 million, net of tax. GAAP net earnings per diluted share was $0.35 in the first quarter of 2013, compared to $0.23 in the first quarter of 2012. Non-GAAP net earnings per diluted share was $0.38 in the first quarter of 2013, compared to $0.27 in the first quarter of 2012. Non-GAAP net earnings per diluted share for the quarter would have been $0.35 per share including $0.03, net of tax, related to stock-based compensation.

Message.Title: Earnings Announced
Message.Msg: GAAP revenue $1,140 million Revenue ex-TAC $1,074 million GAAP income from operations $186 million Non-GAAP income from operations* $224 million GAAP net earnings per diluted share $0.35 Non-GAAP net earnings per diluted share* $0.38

Topic.Title: shorts will get killed they factored in a flat quarter

Message.Msg: Those earnings sucked and they're forecasting a worse 2nd quarter. Eyeballs mean nothing if you can't monetize them. Apple for example has 5% of the PC market yet 40% of its profits. Now if you look at slide 16, you get $6B in cash including AG preferred, $9.2B for Yahoo Japan and $8.1B for AG. $23.3B not including Accts Rec., the core itself divided by 1.10B shares outstanding you get $21.18. They had the core listed at $16B+, a fall from over 17B, so $16B+$17B=$33B/1.1B=$30 per share. They also bought back 38M shares at $778M, I believe, with $775 left which will probably knock out another 30M shares.

Topic.Title: conviction sell...

Message.Msg: two big volume down days say the trend is over and headed down. Don't fight the tape. Yesterday was a dojjii shooting star which crashed on high volume. This was about as classic a top as I've seen in quite a while. Yahoo had a nice monster run that I called the top a little early but I heavily increased my short position when I saw the shooting star formation coming into fruition and sold my calls that I had purchased as a hedge. Classic top baby! If you can't recognize that then you shouldn't be trading! The only way I change my mind is if this gaps down and rallies to close positive on big volume tomorrow. We will see!

Topic.Title: YHOO Buybacks estimated at 250,000/day @ $21.45 average price

Message.Msg: "This (cash) is down from the $6 billion at year end because we repurchased 38.1 million shares of stock in the first quarter at an average price of $20.35 for our $775 million." March buybacks were only 5.1 million shares for $112 million, so we could see a splurge soon. Maybe some deductive reasoning could predict an accurate buyback volume and average share price.
